learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate an understanding of hospitality/tourism management from a service management perspective.
Analyse the inter-relationship between operations, general management, human resources and marketing within an organisation as an integrated whole.
Consider and reflect upon current best practice in relation to measuring business performance for service-related businesses.

In class - During week 4 and week 5. Students will be expected to respond to questions.
assessments.task_description:
This assessment asks you to critically reflect on your own service experiences from a customer perspective and to apply a core service management concept to help explain and analyse that experience.

Students will choose from a selection of topics provided. Your task is to identify a real service experience (positive or negative) that clearly illustrates this concept, and to demonstrate how the concept helps make sense of what happened and why it mattered.

In Weeks 4 and 5, you will deliver a short (3 minutes), live, in-person pitch to the class. In this pitch, you will:

  • Briefly describe the chosen service experience
  • Clearly explain the allocated service management concept
  • Explicitly connect the concept to the experience, showing how it helps interpret or explain the customer experience.

The primary emphasis of the pitch is on clarity and insight, not detail. You should be able to clearly articulate the link between theory and practice within a short time frame and respond to questions from the lecturer and classmates.

This pitch is not a standalone task. It is designed to help you test and refine your thinking, and it will form the foundation for your Service Experience Report, where you will develop your analysis in greater depth. Criteria sheet will be posted to Blackboard.

Please Note: The assessment will be recorded for marking purposes per UQ Policy.

AI Statement

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

assessments.task_description:
You are required to reflect upon your own service experiences from a real customer perspective. Then link one of these experiences based on your first assessment (Service Experience Transcript) to a relevant service concept. You will write a short 'literature review' on your service concept which links theory to practice. Finally, providing a specific guide to managers about how to use this service concept in practice.

There are two parts to this assessment task:

  1. Identify a service experience based on your allocated topic (given in tutorials). (NOTE: this is from the viewpoint of the customer).
  2. Then, you will write a 1200 word report which includes an introduction to your service experience, why it connects to your allocated service concept, a literature review and finally management recommendations.
  • Students will be expected to incorporate elements from in class activities to support the ideas developed in the report

Topics will be allocated in Tutorials.

Criteria sheet will be posted to Blackboard.
